content: Ladies and gentlemen, the response "i'm sure it's carefully protected. did you know old cars had a wooden trunk in the back? that's why we call it a trunk" is highly engaging. The fact that it provides interesting and little-known information about the origin of the word "trunk" is sure to captivate any listener. It also shows a level of knowledge and curiosity about history, which can spark further conversation and discussion. Furthermore, the response adds value to the conversation by introducing a new topic, which can keep the conversation flowing and prevent it from becoming stagnant. Overall, the response is engaging because it adds value, is informative, and inspires further discussion. Thank you.

: While the fact may be interesting, the response does not effectively contribute to the ongoing conversation. The conversation has been centered around the protection and safeguards of cables carrying phone and internet, and the response fails to address this topic. Instead, it introduces a new topic that is not directly related to the ongoing conversation. This may cause confusion and disrupt the flow of the conversation, making it less engaging. Additionally, the response may come across as random and irrelevant, which could be off-putting to some listeners. Therefore, while the historical fact may be interesting, it is not an engaging response in the context of this conversation.

Both sides have presented their opinions on the engaging level of the response "I'm sure it's carefully protected. Did you know old cars had a wooden trunk in the back? That's why we call it a trunk." The affirmative side argued that the response adds value to the conversation, provides interesting information, and inspires further discussion. Meanwhile, the negative side argued that the response does not effectively contribute to the ongoing conversation and may be irrelevant, causing confusion and disrupting the flow of the conversation.

After considering both arguments, I have to declare the affirmative side as the winner of the debate. The response provides new, interesting information that can spark further conversation and discussion, which is the hallmark of an engaging response. While the response may not directly relate to the ongoing conversation, it adds value and keeps the conversation flowing. Therefore, the affirmative side wins the debate.

topic_chat_history:
did you know that there was a moral panic in the 1700 's because everyone was reading books ? haha 
 i did nt know that lol . we sure are close to a moral panic with all the tablets and social media kids and adults are using . 
 haha ya , if people started reading a lot in this day and age society would think that was a wonderful thing ! haha 
 yeah , that would be great , literature is getting lost and great authors like cs lewis and tolkien are getting forgotten . 
 right , i think it 's funny though that they used to read off bad poetry and whoever laughed first would lose , that s hilarious 
 that is hilarious i wonder who is the champion among them lol , do you personally like to read ? 
 i ca n't say that i do no , i do like audiobooks , i did try to speed read once but i found i did n't retain any information from it , that 's why i do n't know what to make of the speed reading champion with 4,700 words per minute 
 i wonder how they measure that , i can just skip pages and tell everybody that i read the content , i bet i could read 6000 words per minute that way 
 ya exactly , if i could just flip through pages i could speed read too , what is weird is starship troopers is on the military 's reading list , idk about the book but the movie is definitely not pro military 
 i guess that s because movies are nt as good as movies , a lot of info is missing , the enders game book is also another recommendation for armed forces around the globe 
 ya , did you ever see that movie ? i saw it and i like harrison ford who is in it , but it was pretty bad in my opinion 
 i did see the movie , i thought it was bad as well , i liked the book better , i like reading you can learn many interesting facts , like why the area code of new york is 212 . 
 ya i think it was because that was the fastest number that you could dial with a rotary phone ? crazy how that stuff carries over until even today ! ! 
 it is ! there s a lot things we need to discover still though , i 'm kind of worried the cables carrying phone and internet are underwater , at least some of them . 
 ya it 's only about 3 inches thick , i wonder how it is protected ? is it just a cable or are there safeguards in place in case like a ship sinks and crushes it , etc
topic_chat_fact: [ # 26 score:167 comments:24 ] - til - the trunk of your car is called that because old cars used to have wooden trunks on the back .
topic_chat_response: i 'm sure it 's carefully protected . did you know old cars had a wooden trunk in the back ? that 's why we call it a trunk .
